text: I’d be really into that. Jund Saprolings and Jund -1/-1 counters are also on my short list
Sign me up for those ouch counters.

Same. I love them in concept. Depending on what the General did it may invalidate Hapatra, but eh.

Jund Lands I think is safe unless they make the general incredibly powerful. Gitrog, Titania, Angry Omnath are all great incentives for having them as commanders
I know it’s been done via Karador, but would having something like “CARD NAME costs 1 less to cast for every two lands in your graveyard” be interesting or just derivative?
Derivative, but not necessarily unfun
I think if it had that ability it could get away with having some ability with “Sacrifice a land:”
I was thinking of trying Wasitoria as an extra combat step/double strike commander
That sounds super sweet
that is a way better idea than what I had for her
which was very all over the place, fun, but all over
had the infinite combat combo in red/green though
with [[savage ventmaw]] and that other dragon

text:
So I’ve been talking with Mason, and he told me I should share this idea here.

My last article on Trostani got a lot of comments to use Helm of the Host, and after listening to the Commander’s Brew on Helm, I’ve been feeling inspired.

I’ve been wanting to build Saskia for awhile, and I’ve realized building her around around Helm is perfect. She gets all the token and equipment spells, and she gets the creatures that naturally combo with Helm. 

I’m going to write up this deck for my next article.

Does anyone have any suggestions?
it’s a good idea
the biggest downside is you don’t get the cheap equip guys
but you do get a lot of token doublers
you’ll want some of the “deals damage as though they weren’t blocked” creatures I think
What do you mean you don't get the cheap equip guys?
the mirrodin crusader, sigarda’s aid
wait
she’s not non-white
Racist!
would you believe me when I say it’s too early for me?
[[saskia]]

attachments.fallback: Saskia the Unyielding {B}{R}{G}{W} // Legendary Creature — Human Soldier // Vigilance, haste // As Saskia the Unyielding enters the battlefield, choose a player. // Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to the chosen player. // 3/4
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Human Soldier
Vigilance, haste
As Saskia the Unyielding enters the battlefield, choose a player.
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to the chosen player.
*3/4*
attachments.title: Saskia the Unyielding {B}{R}{G}{W}

text:
Yeah we get white :) 

Stoneforge Mystic!!

I’m aware of Siege Behemoth as a way to get combat damage through blocks.

Are there any other important ones?
there’s an infect one
Thorn Elemental, Tornado Elemental, other worse ones.
Spells too… [[Predatory Focus]], [[Outmaneuver]],

attachments.fallback: Predatory Focus {3}{G}{G} // Sorcery // You may have creatures you control assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
You may have creatures you control assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
_Instinct blood-tinted his world until he could see only one thing clearly: his prey._
attachments.title: Predatory Focus {3}{G}{G}

attachments.fallback: Outmaneuver {X}{R} // Instant // X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
attachments.text:
Instant
X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
_"Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics." —Jula, goblin raider_
attachments.title: Outmaneuver {X}{R}

text: There are also some older odd effects you can get by choosing to NOT deal combat damage if the creature is unblocked.
Like [[Bone Dancer]]

attachments.fallback: Bone Dancer {1}{B}{B} // Creature — Zombie // Whenever Bone Dancer attacks and isn't blocked, you may put the top creature card of defending player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. If you do, Bone Dancer assigns no combat damage this turn. // 2/2
attachments.text:
Creature — Zombie
Whenever Bone Dancer attacks and isn't blocked, you may put the top creature card of defending player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. If you do, Bone Dancer assigns no combat damage this turn.
*2/2*
attachments.title: Bone Dancer {1}{B}{B}

blade of selves will probably do well in the same themed deck

text: you will have to make a note for your readers that you’ll have to tell people to keep thier yards in order for once
I ran that in breya for a short while
They have to just not rearrange things…they can put creatures in any order after a wipe, but otherwise…
yup
I just know that some people who use graveyard decks like to re-arrange their yard so they can get what they are after quickly
Sure…if Bone Dancer’s out they have to not do that, otherwise they can.
Weird cards… [[Delif’s Cone]]
